backend/main.mo: Implements insecure demo email/password auth with session tokens, credential lookup, signup/login flows, and access‑control role assignment.
feature_evidence.json: Provides feature evidence metadata describing two Internet Identity configuration features and their associated components, files, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Contains prewritten summaries for many frontend files, describing their roles in the timer, scramble system, UI, and authentication.
frontend/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and OKLCH color variables for light/dark themes used across the app.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point that loads the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Wraps the main TimerScreen component with theme and email/password auth providers.
frontend/src/components/EventSelector.ts: Event dropdown component for choosing WCA events with disabled state support.
frontend/src/components/LoginModal.tsx: Email/password login and signup modal with validation, error handling, and mode switching.
frontend/src/components/ScramblePanel.ts: Displays the current scramble with a refresh button and loading state.
frontend/src/components/ScrambleVisualiz: Loads and renders a 2D puzzle visualization using TwistyPlayer from a CDN with error and loading handling.
frontend/src/components/SessionStats.tsx: Displays session stats in a card by mapping stat fields into a grid layout.
frontend/src/components/SolveHistory.tsx: Renders a scrollable grid of past solves with formatted times and DNF/+2 indicators.
frontend/src/components/TimerDisplay.tsx: Shows formatted timer or inspection time with state‑based text and colors, handling pointer events for starting and stopping the timer.
frontend/src/components/TimerScreen.tsx: Main timer page managing event selection, scrambles, solves, session persistence, and login modal behavior.
frontend/src/config/iiOrigins.ts: Defines Internet Identity derivation origin and alternative origins for stable principal mapping.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, invalidating dependent queries when identity changes.
Manages email/password auth, session restoration, and token storage using the backend actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity context, loading stored identities and exposing login/clear functions via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder file noting no backend queries are used.
frontend/src/hooks/useWcaScramble.ts: Generates and stores WCA scrambles using cubing.js, exposing scramble state and a generation function.
frontend/src/hooks/useWcaTimerControls.t: React hook managing WCA-style timer state, inspection countdown, audio warnings, and timing logic.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles and theme variables defining light/dark color palettes and timer-specific colors.
frontend/src/lib/inspectionAudio.ts: Utility using Web Audio API to initialize audio and play inspection warning beeps.
frontend/src/lib/sessionCookie.ts: Functions to save and load session data in cookies with basic validation.
frontend/src/lib/sessionStats.ts: Computes session statistics such as current time, best, ao5, ao12, and mo3.
frontend/src/lib/wcaEvents.ts: Defines metadata for supported WCA events and their scramble IDs.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point setting up React root, queries, identity provider, and global styles.
frontend/src/types/cubing.d.ts: Type declarations for cubing.net scramble and twisty modules.
frontend/src/types/solves.ts: Types for solves and helpers to format display time and compute numeric time including penalties.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading, persisting, and clearing URL and session parameters.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration with custom colors, typography, animations, and timer theme extensions.
project_state.json: Tracks project state for migrating Internet Identity to mcubes.net, adding admin and email/password auth features, and fixing missing backend methods. Includes architectural notes, known issues, existing features, and new feature requests.
